intro: Melicope accedens, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mesic forests. Melicope accedens plays a role in the ecological dynamics of Hawaii's unique flora.
